channel.title: Anticipating download location
channel.description:
I often download a variety of files, with different formats. What annoys me, is that when I first download a .torrent file, and then an .epub file, the interface thingy thinks I want to save the .epub at the same location as the .torrent file. So I have to browse (in the interface) to the location I want to save the file.
Is there a plugin or whatever that automatically opens up my ebook folder (in the 'save' dialog) for .epub files, and torrent folder for .torrent files?

item.title: Anticipating download location
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Free Download Manager is what I used to use on windows as it detects file types and saves them where you want.

I do believe it supports torrents too. Much better than IDM.

Monitors the clipboard, and browser, it’s really nice actually. Pity there’s nothing quite like it for linux, although you can run a few different things to get the same effect.

There are chrome plugins that integrate with FDM, but not a plugin that has the feature set of FDM.
